title: Train Collides with SUV in Hesperia; Driver Escapes Unharmed - vvng.com
content:
HESPERIA, Calif. (VVNG.com) ‚Äî A train struck an SUV Sunday evening in Hesperia, but the driver was able to escape moments before impact.
The incident was reported at approximately 6:13 p.m. on January 25, 2026, near the intersection of W. Santa Fe Avenue and Deodar Street.
A white SUV became disabled on the tracks and was struck by a BNSF freight train hauling tanker cars.
Emergency crews responded to the scene and determined that no injuries occurred as a result of the crash.
According to preliminary information, the driver of the SUV managed to exit the vehicle before it was hit.
It is believed the driver may have fallen asleep prior to the collision. Drugs or alcohol are not suspected to be factors in the incident.
Train traffic was temporarily halted while crews worked to remove the damaged vehicle from the tracks.
The investigation is being handled by BNSF Police, and no further details have been released.

Deadly Crash Shuts Down Folsom Light Rail

A deadly crash shuts down Folsom light rail near Iron Point Station on Thursday afternoon, January 22, 2026, disrupting Sacramento Regional Transit (SacRT) service. A vehicle struck the station ramp and overturned onto the tracks, blocking service between the Sunrise and Historic Folsom stations.

Folsom police confirmed that a pedestrian was killed, and another individual was transported to a hospital for treatment. SacRT crews inspected the tracks for damage before resuming normal service around 8 p.m., with a bus bridge in place to maintain transit along the affected route.

Footage from the scene showed the sedan resting at an angle across the tracks, with damage to the station parking lot, indicating a violent collision through the area prior to impacting the tracks.

Safety Tips Near Transit Stations

Incidents like this highlight the importance of safety around light rail stations and transit areas:

Observe speed limits and stop signs in parking lots and near station ramps.

Be vigilant for pedestrians in high-traffic transit zones.

Avoid distractions while driving, especially near busy stations with foot traffic.

Yield to emergency responders and follow detours when incidents occur.

Being alert in transit areas can prevent severe collisions and save lives.
